page.title: 13Wick Court
page.content: There is a large country house in Wick called{Wick Court}.It stands in the middle of the village and was built in the first half of the seventeenth century. The main entrance on the eastern side goes into a square hall which has a floor made of flagstones. To the right of the hall is the dining room, to the left is the library. The kitchens are at the rear of the house. It has the most important relic. On the ground floor is a spit wheel which originally was turned by a small dog walking around in a space. Upstairs there is a hidden compartment which still opens at the slightest touch. It is now used as a residential centre for school children ,mostly from city areas,who can come and enjoy life in the countryside.
